Diaspora

Album Concept

The year is 2280, roughly 70 years after the 10 year span of casualties by the Necro-Pelagicia Virus also known as the era of "The Great Plague". The Great Plague bottlenecked the human population to around 3 billion people. Due to this disaster, not to mention the level of technology, the remaining humans were left with an of abundance of resources and space. Further, the deluge of death left not one person unaffected and because of this humanity's empathy for their fellow man and appreciation of life reached a level unseen in recorded history. This heightened empathy and understanding was later referred to as the "Organic Singularity".


Within the 30 years after the "Organic Singularity" breakthroughs in science lead to the mapping of the brain and the digitization of human consciences which was deemed "The Singularity”. Needless to say such a breakthrough raised a number of ethical issues. However, regulation through a number of check and balance implemented by AI coupled with the paradigm shift caused by the Organic Singularity, humanity dealt and continues to deal with this issue responsibly.

Aside from the major recreational advances digitized consciousness has brought forth it has been primarily used for what has driven humanity ever since it climbed down from the trees and set foot on the African Savanna, exploration. Humans now explore the depths of the ocean, the deepest caves, and of course the final frontier, space! On March 30th, 2280 during an expedition to Jupiter's moon Europa an ancient yet advanced "alien artifact" was discovered. However, to humanity's surprise, it wasn't "ancient" or "alien" at all but actually from humanity’s distant future and a rather bleak one at that.
